page.title: 18Energy demand in Halesowen
page.content: Most people in Halesowen use one or more of the following sources of energy in their homes:- electricity, gas, oil, coal Coal was mined in Halesowen from 1886 to 1953, supplying industrial and domestic needs. Electricity and gas supplies reach Halesowen through pipes and cables laid underneath the roads. We know this because workmen are always digging up the roads to make repairs to them! Electricity is used in homes for appliances such as washing machines, lighting, tv's, fridges and freezers, and heating. We have calcuated that Halesowen homes use 195 million units of electricity in a year - a total cost of about Â£11 million.
